title: ICE: unstable fingerprints for optimized_mir(rustc_middle)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
This is happening when building Rust on WSL2 on Windows. `./x.py build` completes successfully, but `./x.py install` fails.

My `config.toml` looks like this:

```
# Includes one of the default files in src/bootstrap/defaults
profile = "compiler"
changelog-seen = 2

[install]
prefix = "/home/tor/projects/rust/install"
```

### Error output

```

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.53.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```
